div1.p: Kean hopes that the misleading statements about Reed in the Gorgas biography will be corrected. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L. O. Howard, May 6, 1924
div1.opener:
6
JRK/FM
6 May 1924.
Dr. L. O. Howard,
Chief, Bureau of Entomology,
U. S. Department of Agriculture,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Your letter of May 1st about Reed's work gave me the
greatest pleasure and satisfaction. I have taken the liberty
to send a copy of it to Mr. Burton J. Hendrick, the Editor of
the World's Work, not for publication but because he is a col-
laborator with Mrs. Gorgas in the Gorgas biography. I hope
that they will correct the statements which are misleading
and objectionable to Mrs. Reed and Reed's friends.
They did not
correct them.
J. R. K.

After my retirement, a couple of months hence, I
hope to come to Washington to live and then shall give myself
the pleasure of calling on you.
